Package org.moera.lib.node.types.principal

Class Principal

java.lang.Object
org.moera.lib.node.types.principal.Principal
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, PrincipalFilter
public class Principal extends Object implements Cloneable, PrincipalFilter
Represents a principal entity in Moera that encapsulates various predefined types and behaviors for node access control.

A principal represents an entity with a specific relationship with the current node and the protected object, such as "admin", "private", etc. Additionally, parametrized principals can be created based on nodes or friend groups.

    • NONE

      public static final Principal NONE

    • ADMIN

      public static final Principal ADMIN
      Node administrator.

    • SIGNED

      public static final Principal SIGNED
      Any authenticated Moera node.

    • SUBSCRIBED

      public static final Principal SUBSCRIBED
      Any Moera node this node is subscribed to. For access control purposes, only subscription to the node's "timeline" feed is taken into account.

    • PRIVATE

      public static final Principal PRIVATE
      Refer Access controls documentation for the exact definition.

      public static final Principal PUBLIC
      Any client, authenticated or not.

    • UNSET

      public static final Principal UNSET
      Undefined. This is a special value used in overrides. It means that the higher-level object does not override the permission, so the object’s own permission takes effect.

    • getNodeNames

      public String[] getNodeNames()
      Retrieves the names of the nodes if the current principal represents a "node" or "only" type.
      Returns:
      an array of node names if the principal is a "node" or "only" type, otherwise an empty array.

    • getFriendGroupId

      public String getFriendGroupId()
      Retrieves the identifier of the friend group associated with the principal. If the current principal represents a "friends" principal, the identifier is extracted and returned. Otherwise, null is returned.
      Returns:
      the friend group identifier if the principal is a "friends" principal, otherwise null.

    • withOwner

      public Principal withOwner(String ownerName)
      Converts a relative principal to an absolute one. Some principals, like "owner" or "private" cannot be verified without knowing the owner of the protected object. This method receives the owner's name as a parameter and converts the current principal to an absolute one, like "node", "only" or "admin" that can be verified without any additional knowledge.

      For example, "private" principal with ownerName == "usopp" is converted to "node:usopp" principal.

      Parameters:
      ownerName - the owner's name
      Returns:
      the absolute principal

    • withOwner

      public Principal withOwner(String ownerName, String seniorName)
      Converts a relative principal to an absolute one. Some principals, like "senior" or "private" cannot be verified without knowing the owner of the protected object and its senior. This method receives the owner's name and senior's name as parameters and converts the current principal to an absolute one, like "node", "only" or "admin" that can be verified without any additional knowledge.

      For example, "private" principal with ownerName == "usopp" and seniorName == "nami" is converted to "node:usopp,nami" principal.

      Parameters:
      ownerName - the owner's name
      seniorName - the senior's name
      Returns:
      the absolute principal

    • withOwner

      public Principal withOwner(String ownerName, String seniorName, String majorName)
      Converts a relative principal to an absolute one. Some principals, like "secret" or "private" cannot be verified without knowing the owner of the protected object and its senior and major. This method receives the owner's name, senior's name and major's name as parameters and converts the current principal to an absolute one, like "node", "only" or "admin" that can be verified without any additional knowledge.

      For example, "private" principal with ownerName == "usopp", seniorName == "nami" and seniorName == "arlong" is converted to "node:usopp,nami,arlong" principal.

      Parameters:
      ownerName - the owner's name
      seniorName - the senior's name
      majorName - the major's name
      Returns:
      the absolute principal

    • withSubordinate

      public Principal withSubordinate(Principal principal)
      Returns the given principal if the current principal is unset; otherwise, returns the current principal.
      Parameters:
      principal - the subordinate principal to be returned if the current principal is unset
      Returns:
      the provided subordinate principal if the current principal is unset; otherwise, the current principal

    • includes

      public boolean includes(boolean admin, String nodeName, boolean subscribed, String[] friendGroups)
      Determines whether a client with the given privileges is included in the principal.
      Specified by:
      includes in interface PrincipalFilter
      Parameters:
      admin - indicates whether the client has administrative privileges
      nodeName - the name of the client's node
      subscribed - indicates whether the current node is subscribed to the client's node
      friendGroups - an array of the friend groups the client's node is a member of
      Returns:
      true if the client satisfies the inclusion criteria, false otherwise
      Throws:
      UnresolvedPrincipalException - if the principal cannot be checked without additional knowledge

    • includes

      public boolean includes(boolean admin, String nodeName, Supplier<Boolean> subscribed, Supplier<String[]> friendGroups)
      Determines whether a client with the given privileges is included in the principal.
      Parameters:
      admin - indicates whether the client has administrative privileges
      nodeName - the name of the client's node
      subscribed - supplier providing the subscription status of the client
      friendGroups - supplier providing the client's friend groups
      Returns:
      true if the client satisfies the inclusion criteria, false otherwise
      Throws:
      UnresolvedPrincipalException - if the principal cannot be checked without additional knowledge

    • isOneOf

      public boolean isOneOf(int flags)
      Checks if the current principal matches any of the specified flags.
      Parameters:
      flags - a combination of PrincipalFlag flags.
      Returns:
      true if the current principal matches one of the specified flags; false otherwise
      See Also:
      • PrincipalFlag

    • union

      public Principal union(Principal principal)
      Creates a principal that includes any client that is included by the current principal or the principal passed as a parameter.

      Note: It is not always possible to find a principal that exactly fits the criteria (for example, a union of two unrelated groups of friends). In this case, the method returns the narrowest principal that fits (in the case of two unrelated groups of friends, it is "signed").

      Parameters:
      principal - the principal to create a union with
      Returns:
      the union principal

    • intersect

      public Principal intersect(Principal principal)
      Creates a principal that includes any client that is included by both the current principal and the principal passed as a parameter.

      Note: It is not always possible to find a principal that exactly fits the criteria (for example, an intersection of two unrelated groups of friends). In this case, the method returns the narrowest principal that fits (in the case of two unrelated groups of friends, it is one of these groups).

      Parameters:
      principal - the principal to create an intersection with
      Returns:
      the intersection principal

    • a

      public PrincipalExpression a()
      Creates a PrincipalExpression from this principal.
      Specified by:
      a in interface PrincipalFilter
      Returns:
      the expression

    • not

      public PrincipalExpression not()
      Creates a PrincipalExpression that represents the logical NOT of this principal.
      Returns:
      the expression representing the negated principal
